thread.title: Former NFL, Georgia LB Quentin Moses Among 3 People Killed in House Fire
thread.title_full: Former NFL, Georgia LB Quentin Moses Among 3 People Killed in House Fire

author: Timothy Rapp
title: Former NFL, Georgia LB Quentin Moses Among 3 People Killed in House Fire
text:
Former NFL, Georgia LB Quentin Moses Among 3 People Killed in House Fire Mike Zarrilli/Getty Images Timothy Rapp Featured Columnist February 12, 2017 Former Georgia and NFL linebacker Quentin Moses died in a house fire Sunday in Monroe, Georgia, according to Ellen Eldridge of the Atlanta Journal-Constitution . 
Andria Godard, 31, and her 10-year-old daughter, Jasmine Godard, also died in the fire. 
Moses was 33. 
The fire reportedly started Sunday morning at 6 a.m. ET, per Eldridge, and authorities are still investigating the cause of the blaze. 
"We are all saddened by this life-taking tragedy,” Monroe fire chief Keith Glass told Eldridge. "Our thoughts and prayers are with the victims’ families." 
Georgia coach Kirby Smart offered his condolences upon hearing the news: 
So did former Oakland Raiders teammate Kirk Morrison: 
After a decorated college career with Georgia, Moses was selected as the first pick in the third round of the 2007 NFL draft by the Raiders. He was cut by the team before the season, however. He was then claimed by the Arizona Cardinals in Sept. 2007 before being cut a month later. 
He eventually settled with the Miami Dolphins, spending four years with the team. After his playing career concluded, he took on a role as the defensive line coach at Reinhardt University.
